content:
1. Prepara il tuo template HTML con sfondo e firma usando un editot HTML (se non ne hai uno potresti iniziare con Seamonkey Composer -> https://www.seamonkey-project.org/) e salvalo su disco; In alternativa scarica da internet un template HTML di tuo gradimento.
  2. Apri il template HTML con un editot di solo testo (ad esempio il Blocco note di Windows) e copia tutto il testo del file.
  3. Apri Thunderbird e inizia a comporre un nuovo messaggio; Vai quindi nel menu Inserisci > Html e incolla il codice compiato sopra.
  4. Vai ora nel menu File > Salva come > Modello e salva il template in Thunderbird.
  5. Il modello verrà salvato in una nuova cartella Thunderbird chiamata Modelli da cui si potrà riutilizzare con un doppio click.
creator: @next

content: Gmail only works with an email client if there is NO PASSWORD found. Be sure you remove any remnants of password and then check mail. Google will prompt for your id and password and will then show an 'allow' button. Click that and Google will store a unique passcode in Thunderbird for you. that passcode is for your PC only and is not transferable.
creator: davidsk

content: It could be a variety of reasons, but if you post complete SMTP settings, there may be a suggestion or two. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: My guess is you're using the classic view. I don't know long-term solution there, but for now, I suggest switching to vertical or wide view.
creator: davidsk

content: My experience is to NOT use your password on initial setup. If one is present, you will usually get a message of incorrect password. Remove any password on the account and try again. Google will prompt for it.

content:
Try to start Windows 10 in safe mode with networking enabled. Does the problem go away?

Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software. This is a troubleshooting step, not a solution.

content:
So there definitely is something related to sending, but I'm not quite sure what it means.

WebGL context was lost.

I'm somewhat guessing here - is hardware acceleration enabled in your Thunderbird settings? If so, try to turn it off.

content: Turned off hardware acceleration. Same error recurred. Thank you for your continued suggestions.
creator: ldscottconsultingllc

content:
Lost "just about anything" is often related to antivirus scanning. However if windows safe mode with networking did not allow sending on a wired connection (Windows has no wifi on safe mode) then more detailed logging is probably the next step.

Enable logging in the config editor Set mailnews.smtp.loglevel, string, to All Then check the error console for a more verbose reporting of mail sending.

Generally I suggest open the error console first, clear it. Then try sending and right click in the console and copy everything and paste it into a reply here. That mostly limits the stuff from the console to relevant time and place stuff.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I've had the same error and eventually found that I was running Thunderbird as snap. It came preinstalled when I upgraded Ubuntu 23.10 to 24.04. Once I uninstalled the snap package and installed Thunderbird from ppa, everything worked fine. I'm running version 115.12.2. So for me replacing snap with ppa was the solution. The uninstall and install from ppa (or deb) is described well here: https://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2024/03/install-thunderbird-deb-ubuntu-2404/
creator: johnzondag

content:
@johnzondag

You actually need to modify the sandbox settings in the snap, not change release types. You chosen distribution has adopted SNAP for all software, not just Thunderbird. Unless you get it right you will be back using Windows in a short time.
creator: MattAuSupport
